intro: Smithia setulosa, commonly known as the hairy saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing habit and dense, hairy foliage. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold climates. Smithia setulosa is often found in tundra and mountainous environments where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems.
